awards: James Beard Award for Best Chef: Southwest (2019)

recipes.cooking_method: In a large Dutch oven, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon and set aside. Add the chicken to the pot and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the chicken and set aside. Add the onion and garlic to the pot and cook until soft. Add the wine and bring to a simmer. Add the chicken and bacon back to the pot and simmer for 1-2 hours, until the chicken is tender. Serve with crusty bread.
In a large pot, cook the onion until soft. Add the eggplant, zucchini, and bell pepper and cook until tender. Add the tomatoes and simmer for 20-30 minutes. Serve over rice or with crusty bread.

Preheat the oven to 325°F. In a large bowl, whisk together the cream, egg yolks, sugar, and vanilla extract. Pour the mixture into 6 ramekins. Place the ramekins in a large baking dish and fill the dish with hot water until it reaches halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Bake for 40-50 minutes, until the custards are set but still slightly jiggly in the center. Let cool to room temperature, then chill in the fridge for at least 2 hours. Sprinkle the turbinado sugar over the custards and use a kitchen torch to caramelize the sugar.

Add the onion and garlic to the pot and cook until soft. Add the wine and bring to a simmer. Add the chicken and bacon back to the pot and simmer for 1-2 hours, until the chicken is tender. Serve with crusty bread.
In a large pot, cook the onion until soft. Add the eggplant, zucchini, and bell pepper and cook until tender. Add the tomatoes and simmer for 20-30 minutes. Serve over rice or with crusty bread.
